meanings.definition: The act of writing or collaborating on a piece of work with another person.
meanings.sent1: In our class project, we shared the coauthorship of the story.
meanings.sent2: She was proud of her coauthorship on the research paper.
meanings.sent3: The coauthorship of the book made the process more enjoyable.
meanings.sent4: Their coauthorship was like a dance, each step perfectly in sync.
meanings.sent5: The coauthorship brought out the best in both writers, creating a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: The state of being a coauthor on a publication.
meanings.sent1: His coauthorship on the article was acknowledged by the journal.
meanings.sent2: She received recognition for her coauthorship in the scientific journal.
meanings.sent3: The coauthorship status gave him a sense of accomplishment.
meanings.sent4: Her coauthorship was a badge of honor among her peers.
meanings.sent5: The coauthorship elevated her status in the academic community.
